jesse.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 at the earliest time that works for everyone.

kathryn.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 at the earliest time that works for everyone.

megan.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 at the earliest time that works for everyone.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that finds the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.

public_information: We need to schedule a meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.
Participants are Jesse, Kathryn and Megan.
The group prefers the earliest possible meeting time that fits everyone's schedule.
There exists at least one valid meeting time that works for all participants.

availability.system_prompt: You are a calendar participant. Provide your busy intervals for the specified day as an ordered list of time ranges in HH:MM-HH:MM format.
availability.prompt: Your name is jesse. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private schedule: {agents->jesse->private_information} Your goal: {agents->jesse->goal} Output a machine-readable list of your busy intervals for the day and confirm free intervals within work hours.

availability.system_prompt: You are a calendar participant. Provide your busy intervals for the specified day as an ordered list of time ranges in HH:MM-HH:MM format.
availability.prompt: Your name is kathryn. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private schedule: {agents->kathryn->private_information} Your goal: {agents->kathryn->goal} Output a machine-readable list of your busy intervals for the day and confirm free intervals within work hours.

availability.system_prompt: You are a calendar participant. Provide your busy intervals for the specified day as an ordered list of time ranges in HH:MM-HH:MM format.
availability.prompt: Your name is megan. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private schedule: {agents->megan->private_information} Your goal: {agents->megan->goal} Output a machine-readable list of your busy intervals for the day and confirm free intervals within work hours.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling and PDDL. Using participants' availability information, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem tailored for the FastDownwards solver that finds the earliest feasible 30-minute meeting slot within the given work hours. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions for each participant distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Inputs: {availability_jesse}, {availability_kathryn}, {availability_megan}. Environment info: {environment->init} Task goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Consider that participants may name or represent time intervals differently; reconcile formats and compute the earliest 30-minute slot that is free for all participants. Provide a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
